page.title: 20OUR ENVIRONMENT
page.content: Being an industrial area,our district has been open to the ravages that industry generates. Coalmining left the scars of slagheaps and chasms where opencast mining had taken place.These areas are now being levelled and landscaped to blend into the environment. Rivers were polluted with minerals and coaldust after the coal was washed.Ironworks added their share to the grime in the water and the air.The rivers are cleaner now, sufficient for fish stocks to survive. However modern industry still has the potential to spoil the rivers and pollute the air.We as residents must be vigilant to these dangers and endeavour to preserve the right to clean air,land and rivers.Local pressure groups or national organisations can help our aim.
